intro: Myriocarpa cubilgueitzensis, commonly known as the Andean thimblecactus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its unique, elongated, thimble-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has adapted to survive in harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, edible fruits that are used in local cuisine. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal properties.
